com.ojcoleman.europa.util

Class Interval<T extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.util.Interval<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntervalDouble, IntervalLong

    public abstract class Interval<T extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a numeric interval from a minimum to maximum value, [start, end].
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      T end
      The end of the interval, inclusive.
      T start
      The start of the interval, inclusive.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interval(T s, T e) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract T clamp(T value)
      If the given value is less than the start of this interval then returns the start value.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      abstract boolean isIn(T value)
      Determine if the given value lies within this interval.
      abstract T random(java.util.Random random)
      Get a random uniformly distributed value in the range [start, end] (inclusive).
      abstract T range()
      Returns the range of this Interval: end - start.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Interval: "[start, end]".
      abstract double translateFromUnit(double p)
      Translate a value from the unit interval [0, 1] to the corresponding value from this interval.
      abstract double translateToUnit(double p)
      Translate a value from this interval to the corresponding value from the unit interval [0, 1].

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this Interval: "[start, end]".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • clamp

        public abstract T clamp(T value)
        If the given value is less than the start of this interval then returns the start value. If the given value is greater than the end of this interval then returns the end value. Otherwise returns the given value.

      • translateFromUnit

        public abstract double translateFromUnit(double p)
        Translate a value from the unit interval [0, 1] to the corresponding value from this interval.

      • translateToUnit

        public abstract double translateToUnit(double p)
        Translate a value from this interval to the corresponding value from the unit interval [0, 1].

        Get a random uniformly distributed value in the range [start, end] (inclusive).
